name: ListPagerdutyTeams
description:
Retrieve teams from your PagerDuty account.

Use this tool to list all teams within your PagerDuty account. Teams consist of users and escalation policies representing groups within an organization. You can also apply a search filter. Requires 'teams.read' OAuth scope.

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: Specify the version of the API to use via the Accept header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type_header
parameters.description: Specifies the media type of the resource. Must be 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of results to be displayed per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination of search results. Specify an integer value to skip a number of results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: search_query
parameters.description: Filter the teams to list only those whose names match the search query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses. This toggles total count retrieval for results.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

value_schema.description: Filters the result, showing only the records whose name matches the query.

parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.
